SENT.plain: Rejection and graft vs host disease after HLA-identical allogeneic bone marrow transplantation are probably due to in-vivo T-cell reactivity against non-MHC antigens
Peripheral blood lymphocytes from a patient transplanted for aplastic anemia have been obtained during graft failure and tested for their alloreactivity towards unrelated and marrow donor lymphocytes

Our results demonstrate (1) alloreactive T cells of host origin and (2) the presence of donor-specific host cells in vivo, providing evidence for rejection following in vivo sensitization to non-MHC antigens
